From Wiktionary, the free dictionary
See also: statistik and statistík

German

[edit]

Etymology

[edit]

Derived from New Latin statistica (compare Italian statistica) or statisticus (“of the state”), from obsolete Statist (“statesman”), compare English statist. Coined by Gottfried Achenwall.

Pronunciation

[edit]
  • IPA(key): [ʃtaˈtɪstɪk]
  • Audio (Germany (Berlin)):(file)
  • Rhymes: -ɪstɪk
  • Hyphenation: Sta‧tis‧tik

Noun

[edit]

Statistik f (genitive Statistik, plural Statistiken)

  1. (mathematics, singular only) statistics
  2. (collection of measurements) statistics, stats [from late 18th c.]
  3. (obsolete) description of a state, a country [from early 18th c.]

Declension

[edit]
Declension of Statistik [feminine]
singular plural
indef. def. noun def. noun
nominative eine die Statistik die Statistiken
genitive einer der Statistik der Statistiken
dative einer der Statistik den Statistiken
accusative eine die Statistik die Statistiken
